body_html:
Edit:

By updating the file ./tensorflow/python/client/tf_session_helper.h to include the actual path of the numpy include directory of the computer, I have managed to get a new error,

bazel-out/local_darwin-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.cc:3609:10: fatal error: 'numpy/arrayobject.h' file not found
#include "numpy/arrayobject.h"
         ^
1 warning and 1 error generated.

I have tried to edit this file the same way, but I cannot because it is just a symlink to a tmp direcotry, so it is regenerated each time.

Any ideas?

body:
Edit:

By updating the file `./tensorflow/python/client/tf_session_helper.h` to include the actual path of the numpy include directory of the computer, I have managed to get a new error,

```
bazel-out/local_darwin-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.cc:3609:10: fatal error: 'numpy/arrayobject.h' file not found
#include "numpy/arrayobject.h"
         ^
1 warning and 1 error generated.
```

I have tried to edit this file the same way, but I cannot because it is just a symlink to a tmp direcotry, so it is regenerated each time.

Any ideas?
